results.title: The Unplanned
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Bill Brind and Andy Thomson
results.brief_description:
An industrial accident-prevention film illustrating that an accident usually has several causes. A situation is portrayed in a large machine shop, where a series of unsafe acts, combined with unsafe conditions, led to an accident in which a man’s arm was caught in an unguarded machine. A film to stimulate discussion among managers, supervisors and safety professionals, as well as for all industrial employees.
(Awards: Belgrade; Poznan.)

results.title: The Unorganised manager. Part II. Salvation (NP)
results.brief_description: Provides an overview of time management and delegation practices. “Salvation” shows Richard Lewis, a harassed, overworked and over stressed manager, guided by St Peter towards a more productive managerial mode by learning to delegate effectively. Cast includes John Cleese, James Bolan. FOR USE ONLY IN A DOMESTIC SITUATION OR FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.

results.title: The Unorganised manager. Part I. Damnation (NP)
results.brief_description: Provides an overview of time management and delegation techniques. “Damnation” shows Richard Lewis, an unorganised manager, doing jobs he need not do, wasting his time and the time of others. He becomes so stressed he suffers a coronary. Cast includes John Cleese, James Bolan. FOR USE ONLY IN A DOMESTIC SITUATION OR FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.

results.title: The Unmanageable children = Les enfants terribles
results.brief_description: The unlikely coupling of rigid formalist Jean-Pierre Melville and the lucid dream-like imaginings of Jean Cocteau has produced an intoxicating work which delves into the psychological space that binds a brother and sister together. Based on Cocteau’s 1929 novel, (which he wrote after recovering from opium addiction), “Les Enfants Terribles” explores the obsessive and ultimately destructive relationship between orphaned siblings Elizabeth (Nicole Stephane) and Paul (Edouard Dhermitte). Their intense connection however begins to unravel when Paul falls in love with the ethereal Agathe, played by actress Renee Cosima, who also doubles as Paul’s school yard nemesis, Dargelos. The incestuous desire is delicately suggested by Melville who chooses instead to intricately draw out their secret world of codes and fantasy. Amongst all this lies Cocteau’s beautiful prose (also narrated by Cocteau), which at one point declares that the siblings, “lived like two limbs of a single body”. Cast includes Renee Cosima, Jacques Bernard and Melvyn Martin. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Unlucky ones
results.brief_description: The film promotes the use of fire-resistant materials in the manufacture and purchase of children’s clothing and especially nightwear in the interests of child safety. Shot at the Royal Children’s Hospital, Melbourne, it shows children being brought in by ambulance and their treatment for burns and scalds, including skin grafting; also interviews by the surgeons with the parents about their children’s accidents. Co-produced with the Australian Wool Corporation and the Royal Children’s Hospital, Melbourne.

results.title: The Unlucky country
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Denys Brown and Don Murray
results.brief_description: South Vietnam, a developing country facing the process of improving standards of living, health and education, against a background of constant dissension and war - the dual objectives to win a war and develop a country. Discusses the role of Australian Task Forces in establishing security and providing aid for civil development. Shows the work of the three medical teams.

results.title: The Unknown series (excerpts)
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: In the ‘Unknown Series’, practical hands work with a sense of urgency to construct curious objects out of everyday things. This is a woman at work - not play. She is alone, assuming different persona, constructing objects that might appear to have no function but somehow reflect a state of mind and heart. Baldino has written, ‘Americans will sell you anything, even if they do not know what it is. So, I bought used ‘things.’ This series uses 30 of these objects in separate scenarios. I film a process that takes place in less than 60 seconds. This brief footage is an excerpt, which is actually the completed work. What happens before and after is unknown. Each piece is shot with different personas, and filmed in the first and final take’.

results.title: The Unknown land
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Roland Beckett and Oliver Howes
results.brief_description: Scenes and songs of Australia’s northwest; the Pilbara and Kimberley areas, prospecting (old and new) and mining, pearling at Broome, the Ord River dam, and the cattle industry.
